PSM 0.2.0

Plots an MS2 Spectrum with Fragments

Source: R/plotSpectraWithFragments.R
plotSpectraWithFragments.Rd

Ths

plotSpectraWithFragments(
  x,
  y,
  xlab = "m/z",
  ylab = "intensity",
  type = "h",
  xlim = numeric(),
  ylim = numeric(),
  main = y,
  col = "#00000080",
  labelCex = 1,
  labelSrt = 0,
  labelAdj = NULL,
  labelPos = NULL,
  labelOffset = 0.5,
  axes = TRUE,
  frame.plot = axes,
  ppm = 20,
  tolerance = 0,
  matchCol = "#80B1D3",
  matchLwd = 1,
  matchLty = 1,
  matchPch = 16,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

An instance of class Spectra.
y

character(1) with a peptides sequence.
xlab

character(1)with the label for the x-axis (by defaultxlab = "m/z"`).
ylab

character(1) with the label for the y-axis (by default ylab = "intensity").
type

character(1) specifying the type of plot. See plot.default() for details. Defaults to type = "h" which draws each peak as a line.
xlim

numeric(2) defining the x-axis limits. The range of m/z values are used by default.
ylim

numeric(2) defining the y-axis limits. The range of intensity values are used by default.
main

character(1) with the title for the plot. By default the peptide sequence y is used.
col

color to be used to draw the peaks. Should be either of length 1, or equal to the number of spectra (to plot each spectrum in a different color) or be a list with colors for each individual peak in each spectrum.
labelCex

numeric(1) giving the amount by which the text should be magnified relative to the default. See parameter cex in par().
labelSrt

numeric(1) defining the rotation of the label. See parameter srt in text().
labelAdj

see parameter adj in text().
labelPos

see parameter pos in text().
labelOffset

see parameter offset in text().
axes

logical(1) whether (x and y) axes should be drawn.
frame.plot

logical(1) whether a box should be drawn around the plotting area.
ppm

m/z relative acceptable difference (in ppm) for peaks to be considered matching (see MsCoreUtils::common() for more details).
tolerance

absolute acceptable difference of m/z values for peaks to be considered matching (see MsCoreUtils::common() for more details).
matchCol

color for matching peaks.
matchLwd

line width (lwd) to draw matching peaks. See par() for more details.
matchLty

line type (lty) to draw matching peaks. See par() for more details.
matchPch

point character (pch) to label matching peaks. Defaults to matchPch = 16, set to matchPch = NA to disable. See par() for more details
...

additional parameters to be passed to plot.default().

Value

Used to create a plot.

Author

Johannes Rainer, Sebastian Gibb, Laurent Gatto

Examples


sp <- DataFrame(msLevel = 2L, rtime = 2345, sequence = "SIGFEGDSIGR")
sp$mz <- list(c(100.048614501953, 110.069030761719, 112.085876464844,
                117.112571716309, 158.089569091797, 163.114898681641,
                175.117172241211, 177.098587036133, 214.127075195312,
                232.137542724609, 233.140335083008, 259.938415527344,
                260.084167480469, 277.111572265625, 282.680786132812,
                284.079437255859, 291.208282470703, 315.422576904297,
                317.22509765625, 327.2060546875, 362.211944580078,
                402.235290527344, 433.255004882812, 529.265991210938,
                549.305236816406, 593.217041015625, 594.595092773438,
                609.848327636719, 631.819702148438, 632.324035644531,
                632.804931640625, 640.8193359375, 641.309936523438,
                641.82568359375, 678.357238769531, 679.346252441406,
                688.291259765625, 735.358947753906, 851.384033203125,
                880.414001464844, 881.40185546875, 919.406433105469,
                938.445861816406, 1022.56658935547, 1050.50415039062,
                1059.82800292969, 1107.52734375, 1138.521484375,
                1147.51538085938, 1226.056640625))
sp$intensity <- list(c(83143.03, 65473.8, 192735.53, 3649178.5,
                       379537.81, 89117.58, 922802.69, 61190.44,
                       281353.22, 2984798.75, 111935.03, 42512.57,
                       117443.59, 60773.67, 39108.15, 55350.43,
                       209952.97, 37001.18, 439515.53, 139584.47,
                       46842.71, 1015457.44, 419382.31, 63378.77,
                       444406.66, 58426.91, 46007.71, 58711.72,
                       80675.59, 312799.97, 134451.72, 151969.72,
                       3215457.75, 1961975, 395735.62, 71002.98,
                       69405.73, 136619.47, 166158.69, 682329.75,
                       239964.69, 242025.44, 1338597.62, 50118.02,
                       1708093.12, 43119.03, 97048.02, 2668231.75,
                       83310.2, 40705.72))
sp <- Spectra::Spectra(sp)
plotSpectraWithFragments(sp, sp$sequence, labelPos = 3)
